title: Health Behavior Change
description: Examination of contemporary research, theory and practice related to facilitating healthy behavior change. Analysis of health problems from biological, ecological, and psycho-social perspectives with emphasis on understanding the acquisition and maintenance of healthy behavior. 3 seminars.
prerequisites: KINE 250 or KINE 255 or KINE 260 and KINE 503 or KINE 504 and graduate standing
